featured.text: How does Hirsch explain this difference?
Hirsch looked specifically at two language centers in the brain—Broca’s area, believed to control speech production, and Wernicke’s area, thought to process meaning.
This allowed Hirsch to see which parts of the brain were getting more blood and were more active.
Hirsch thinks that mothers teach a baby to speak by using different methods such as touch, sound, and sight.

definition.zh_def: 一種大型的鹿，通常生活在北美和歐洲，特徵是有分枝的角。
definition.en_def: A large deer, typically found in North America and Europe, characterized by branched antlers.
definition.example: The hirsch grazed peacefully in the meadow.
